title: Trump Proposes Revoking Licenses of "Unfair" Broadcasters, Backs Kimmel Suspensi
snippets: "Maybe their licence should be taken away," Trump said of broadcasters that he argued covered him unfairly.
Trump floats pulling TV licenses after Kimmel suspension
President Donald Trump has applauded the suspension of Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show over comments he made about the man accused of murdering Charlie Kirk.
President says Jimmy Kimmel was ‘not a talented person’ as critics blast show’s suspension as an attack on free speech
Trump’s comment comes after ABC pulled “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” from the air following comments the host made about Charlie Kirk and Trump supporters.
titles: Trump says TV networks 'against' him should 'maybe' lose licence, after Kimmel suspension
Trump floats pulling TV licenses after Kimmel suspension - Axios
Trump floats pulling licenses if networks are 'against' him after Jimmy Kimmel suspended
Trump suggests punishing TV networks for ‘negative’ coverage amid outrage over Kimmel suspension
Trump Says Licenses Should ‘Maybe’ Be Pulled From Networks He Claims Are Critical Of Him
summary: President Donald Trump suggested revoking the licenses of broadcasters he perceives as unfair, following his approval of ABC's decision to suspend "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" The show was pulled after Jimmy Kimmel made comments about Charlie Kirk's accused murderer and criticized Trump supporters. Trump also labeled Kimmel as "not a talented person," amid debates over the suspension's impact on free speech.

title: Palestinians Flee Gaza Conflict; StubHub IPO Drops 6% Despite Milestone
snippets: Can Marcus Rashford finally take the road to redemption at Barcelona after his stunning display sinks Newcastle in the Champions League, asks chief football writer Phil McNulty?
Marcus Rashford enjoys a night to remember at St James' Park as he scores both of Barcelona's goals as they beat Newcastle 2-1 in their opening match of this season's Champions League.
England international Marcus Rashford, on loan from Man Utd, scores twice as Barcelona win 2-1 at Newcastle United.
Can Marcus Rashford finally take the road to redemption at Barcelona after his stunning display sinks Newcastle in the Champions League, asks chief football writer Phil McNulty?
A single image captures the desperation of Palestinians in Gaza City who have once again grabbed what belongings they could and fled the fighting.
Marcus Rashford has praised Barcelona for helping him become a "better player"  and thanked head coach Hansi Flick for restoring his confidence.
titles: Is Rashford on road to redemption at Barcelona after sinking Newcastle?
Rashford stars for Barcelona as they beat Newcastle
Rashford, Barcelona down Newcastle to win their Champions League opener
Is Rashford on road to redemption at Barcelona after sinking Newcastle?
The Road
Rashford: Playing for Barcelona is making me better
summary: In Gaza City, Palestinians were seen fleeing the fighting, taking their belongings with them, highlighting ongoing conflict in the area. Meanwhile, despite a 6% drop in its shares on the first day, StubHub's IPO marks a significant milestone in the co-founder's 25-year journey in the business.

title: Fed Gov. Lisa Cook Faces Removal Amid Rate Cut, Legal Allegations
snippets: Lisa Cook took part in this week’s Fed policy meeting in which the central bank cut interest rates by 0.25%.
President Donald Trump has cited allegations of mortgage fraud by Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook in seeking to remove her.
Governor’s legal team asks court to reject request as her removal ‘would threaten our nation’s economic stability’
The case could determine if President Trump is free to remake the Federal Reserve Board by removing a Democratic appointee who he says may have broken the law.
titles: Trump asks Supreme Court to let him fire Fed governor Cook
Trump administration asks Supreme Court to allow firing of Fed Governor Lisa Cook
Trump asks Supreme Court to let him fire Fed governor Lisa Cook
Trump asks Supreme Court to uphold his firing of Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook
summary: Lisa Cook, a Federal Reserve Governor, participated in a recent Fed policy meeting where interest rates were reduced by 0.25%. President Trump has sought her removal, alleging mortgage fraud. Cook's legal team argues that her removal could jeopardize economic stability. This situation raises questions about the President's authority to replace a Democratic appointee on the Federal Reserve Board based on legal allegations.

title: Dodgers' Clayton Kershaw Announces Retirement After Season
snippets: Clayton Kershaw, a three-time NL Cy Young Award winner and 11-time All-Star with the Los Angeles Dodgers, will retire after this season.
Dodgers icon Clayton Kershaw announced Thursday that this will be his final season.
One of the greatest pitchers from this era of Major League Baseball is set to call it a career at the end of this season.
titles: Dodgers' Kershaw says he'll retire after season
Clayton Kershaw Will Retire From Dodgers After 2025 Season Ends
Dodgers’ Clayton Kershaw to retire at end of season
summary: Clayton Kershaw, a celebrated pitcher for the Los Angeles Dodgers, announced his retirement after this season. Kershaw, known for winning three NL Cy Young Awards and being an 11-time All-Star, is recognized as one of the era's greatest pitchers.

title: Packers' Tucker Kraft Suffers Minor Knee Injury in Practice
snippets: Green Bay Packers standout tight end Tucker Kraft, who sustained a knee injury during practice Thursday, got "a little scare but all good," a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter after tests Thursday.
The injury is reportedly not expected to be a longterm issue

summary: Green Bay Packers tight end Tucker Kraft experienced a knee injury during practice but, following tests, it has been confirmed as not serious and not expected to be a long-term issue. This was reported by ESPN's Adam Schefter, indicating Kraft had "a little scare but all good."

title: Wilson, Smith Named 2025 WNBA Co-Defensive Players of the Year
snippets: Las Vegas Aces star A'ja Wilson was voted WNBA Defensive Player of the Year for the third time in four seasons. This year, she shares the award with Alanna Smith of the Minnesota Lynx.
The Las Vegas Aces’ A’ja Wilson and Minnesota Lynx’s Alanna Smith are the 2025 WNBA Co-Defensive Players of the Year.
There was surprise winner for the WNBA’s defensive player of the year honour. Two, actually.
titles: Aces' Wilson, Lynx's Smith share WNBA D-award
Las Vegas Aces’ A’ja Wilson and Minnesota Lynx’s Alanna Smith are the first WNBA Co-Defensive Players of the Year
Aces’ Wilson, Lynx’s Smith share WNBA’s defensive player of year award
summary: A'ja Wilson of the Las Vegas Aces and Alanna Smith of the Minnesota Lynx were named the 2025 WNBA Co-Defensive Players of the Year. This marks Wilson's third win in four seasons, sharing the honor with Smith in a surprising dual win.

title: Trump Warns UK: Illegal Migration Could "Destroy Countries," Suggests Military B
snippets: The US president says illegal migration "destroys countries from within", as his two-day state visit to the UK comes to a close.
US president ended lavish state visit with a warning that the issue could destroy the UK

US president ends second state visit with warning that illegal migration could destroy the UK

Donald Trump has told Britain it should “call out the military” to control its borders during a tightly controlled summit in which Keir Starmer ducked major flashpoints with the US president.

<
titles: Trump suggests Starmer could use military to control UK borders
Trump tells Starmer to use military to stop illegal migration to Britain
Trump tells Britain to ‘call out the military’ to control its borders
summary: During his two-day state visit to the UK, US President Donald Trump warned that illegal migration could "destroy countries from within," including the UK. He suggested that Britain should deploy the military to control its borders. This statement was made as Trump concluded his visit, during which interactions with UK leaders like Keir Starmer avoided major confrontations.

title: Nvidia Invests $5 Billion in Intel for Data Center, PC Product Development
snippets: Nvidia to invest $5 billion in Intel and co-develop chips  Axios
Deal will see the two US groups co-develop chips for PCs and data centres, but no manufacturing partnership
Intel once considered buying Nvidia outright, but its fortunes have shifted.
titles: Nvidia to invest $5 billion in Intel and co-develop chips - Axios
Nvidia to invest $5bn in rival Intel
Nvidia, Intel to co-develop “multiple generations” of chips as part of $5 billion deal
summary: Nvidia has announced a $5 billion investment in Intel, alongside a partnership to co-develop multiple generations of data center and PC products. This collaboration aims to bolster Intel's position in the market, particularly in AI datacenters and PC chips, following a significant market surge.

title: Kings Captain Anze Kopitar to Retire After 2025-26 Season
snippets: Kings captain Anze Kopitar, who helped lead Los Angeles to Stanley Cups in 2012 and 2014, says he will retire after the 2025-26 season.
Anze Kopitar is putting a bow on his Hall of Fame career.
titles: Kings captain Kopitar to retire after 2025-26
Kings captain Anze Kopitar announces 2025-26 season will be his last
summary: Anze Kopitar, captain of the Los Angeles Kings and two-time Stanley Cup champion (2012, 2014), announced he will retire after the 2025-26 season, marking the end of his illustrious career.

title: Manchester United Women Qualify for Champions League, Terland Scores Hat-Trick

• Manchester United 3-0 Brann (Utd win 3-1 on agg)

titles: With Haaland and Guardiola, Manchester City can never be counted out in the Champions League
Elisabeth Terland hat-trick takes Manchester United into Women’s Champions League
summary: Manchester United's women's team qualified for the Women’s Champions League main draw for the first time, defeating Brann 3-0 and winning 3-1 on aggregate. Elisabeth Terland scored a hat-trick in the victory.

title: GSA Leases Offices for ICE Amid Surge in Nationwide Raids, 10,588 Detained
snippets: Employees at the General Services Administration are scrambling to lease offices to accommodate a rapid increase of immigration enforcement officers carrying out widespread raids across the country.
Immigration and Customs Enforcement locked up at least 10,588 people alone from April 2024 to May 2025, according to experts at Physicians for Human Rights.
titles: Trump administration rushes to rent space for immigration officers conducting raids
Trump administration increasingly places immigrants in solitary confinement, report finds
summary: The General Services Administration is quickly leasing offices for the expanding number of immigration enforcement officers conducting nationwide raids. Between April 2024 and May 2025, Immigration and Customs Enforcement detained over 10,588 individuals, as reported by Physicians for Human Rights.

title: Trump, Starmer Discuss Gaza, Ukraine; Sign Tech Pact, UK May Recognize Palestine
snippets: President Trump and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer talked about foreign affairs privately for about an hour, including the conflicts in Gaza and Ukraine.
President Trump and Prime Minister Keir Starmer discussed the wars in Gaza and Ukraine during Mr. Trump’s state visit. Earlier, the two leaders signed a technology partnership agreement.
Prime Minister Keir Starmer is expected to confirm that the British government will vote to recognize a Palestinian state hours or days after President Trump’s visit to Britain.
titles: Trump says he disagrees with Starmer's decision to recognize Palestinian state
Trump and Starmer Acknowledge Divide Over Palestinian Statehood
U.K. to Formally Recognize Palestinian Statehood After Trump Departs
summary: President Trump and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer had a private discussion about the conflicts in Gaza and Ukraine during Trump's state visit. They also signed a technology partnership agreement. Following Trump's visit, Starmer is expected to announce the British government's intention to vote on recognizing a Palestinian state.

title: RFK Jr.'s Appointed Group Influences Shift in MMRV Vaccine Policy

CDC panel votes to limit MMRV vaccines &
titles: CDC advisers vote to change guidance on MMRV vaccines
CDC panel votes to limit MMRV vaccines - Axios
summary: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. appointed a group amid controversy over their qualifications. This group has now influenced the changing of vaccine guidance for measles, mumps, rubella, and chickenpox. A CDC panel voted to limit the use of MMRV vaccines, reflecting this new direction in vaccine policy.

title: Trump Ends UK Visit with £150bn Deals After Meeting PM Starmer
snippets: After a day of royal pomp, President Trump's visit to the United Kingdom closes with a business reception and a meeting with Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
Deals worth £150bn ‘delighted’ Sir Keir Starmer but more details are needed on the commitments
titles: Trump wraps up state visit to U.K.
What investments did the UK secure during US president’s state visit?
summary: President Trump concluded his visit to the UK with a business reception and a meeting with Prime Minister Keir Starmer, following a day of royal ceremonies. The discussions led to deals worth £150bn, which pleased Starmer, although further details on the commitments are awaited.

title: De Bruyne Faces Man City in Brief Return; Haaland Secures Victory

titles: Kevin De Bruyne's return to Manchester City lasts just 25 minutes: Napoli star subbed after early red card

Haaland's performance was pivotal in Manchester City's victory.

title: Nvidia's $5B Investment in Intel Lauded by Analysts, Boosts Market Position
snippets: "Having Jensen's blessing is priceless," wrote Bernstein senior analyst  Stacy Rasgon about Nvidia's $5 billion investment in Intel.
Analysts say the new partnership could help Nvidia in the PC market and offer support to Intel’s server business — though they note the announcement doesn’t mention Intel’s foundry.
titles: Nvidia CEO explains why he's making a $5 billion bet on struggling chip giant Intel
Intel’s stock is soaring. Here’s why Nvidia is investing $5 billion in the chip maker.
summary: Bernstein senior analyst Stacy Rasgon praised Nvidia's $5 billion investment in Intel, highlighting the value of Jensen Huang's (Nvidia's CEO) endorsement. Analysts believe this partnership could bolster Nvidia's position in the PC market and support Intel's server business. However, they pointed out that the announcement did not detail Intel's foundry operations.

title: Federal Judge Blocks Deportation of Minors, Protects Venezuelans
snippets: US federal judge rebukes the Trump administration's claims that the minors' parents wanted them deported.

Double defeat protects Venezuelans with temporary protected status and Guatemalan minors

The Trump administration has been handed a double defeat by judges in immigration cases, barring the executive branch from deportin
titles: Judge keeps block on Trump push to deport Guatemalan unaccompanied children
Judges rule against Trump administration on deporting Guatemalan children and Venezuelans
summary: A US federal judge ruled against the Trump administration's claims regarding the deportation of minors, asserting that their parents did not wish for them to be deported. This decision, part of a double defeat for the administration, also protects Venezuelans with temporary protected status and Guatemalan minors, preventing their deportation by the executive branch.

title: Jordanian Driver Kills Two Israeli Soldiers; Four Die in Gaza Blast
snippets: A driver bringing in aid from Jordan shot two Israeli soldiers dead at a crossing into the occupied West Bank, Jordan and Israel said. Meanwhile, four Israeli soldiers were killed in a blast in southern Gaza. Follow DW.
Israel’s military said the attacker crossed the border in a truck transporting aid. He was armed with a gun and a knife, initially opening fire and then stabbing people.
titles: Middle East: Jordanian aid driver kills 2 Israeli soldiers
Assailant Kills 2 Israeli Soldiers at West Bank-Jordan Border
summary: A driver from Jordan killed two Israeli soldiers at a West Bank crossing and was armed with a gun and knife. Additionally, four Israeli soldiers died in a blast in southern Gaza. The attacker was transporting aid and engaged in both shooting and stabbing.

title: NASA's Laser Tech Proves High-Speed Data Transmission to Mars
snippets: NASA's Deep Space Optical Communications technology has successfully shown that data encoded in lasers can be reliably transmitted, received, and decoded after traveling millions of miles from Earth at distances comparable to Mars. Nearly two years after launching aboard the agency's Psyche mission

The project has exceeded all of its technical goals after two years, setting up the foundations of high-speed communications for NASA’s future human missions to Mars. NASA’s Deep Space Optical Communications technology successfully showed that data encoded in lasers could be reliably transmitted, re
titles: NASA's Deep Space Communications demo exceeds project expectations
NASA’s Deep Space Communications Demo Exceeds Project Expectations
summary: NASA's Deep Space Optical Communications technology, launched on the Psyche mission nearly two years ago, has successfully demonstrated that data encoded in lasers can be reliably transmitted, received, and decoded over millions of miles, similar to the distance to Mars. This achievement exceeds the project's technical goals and establishes a foundation for high-speed communications for future human missions to Mars.

title: Israel Orders Evacuation in Lebanon, Targets Hezbollah; PM Seeks Global Interven
snippets: Israel said it was targeting Hezbollah positions, while Lebanon's PM called for pressure on Israel to stop attacks.
Israel has issued evacuation orders in southern Lebanon as it targets what it’s calling Hezbollah infrastructure.
Israel gave residents an hour to evacuate areas in southern Lebanon after announcing planned attacks on Hezbollah.
titles: Israeli air strikes hit southern Lebanon
Israel launches series of air strikes in southern Lebanon
Lebanon PM Salam slams Israel after fresh attacks on southern Lebanon
summary: Israel issued evacuation orders for southern Lebanon, targeting Hezbollah infrastructure, giving residents an hour to leave. Lebanon's Prime Minister has called for international pressure on Israel to halt these attacks.

title: Obama Critiques ABC's Suspension of Kimmel; Schumer Slams FCC's Carr
snippets: Former President Barack Obama responded to ABC's decision to indefinitely take Jimmy Kimmel's show off the air and warned of "government coercion."
Columbia's Alex Abdo said Brendan Carr of the FCC is close to “the definition of unconstitutional coercion" while Chuck Schumer called his rhetoric "despicable."
titles: Obama says the Trump administration has taken cancel culture to a 'dangerous level.' See how politicians are reacting to Kimmel's suspension.
Trump says Charlie Kirk could have become president as Obama rips Kimmel suspension taking ‘cancel culture’ to a ‘new and dangerous level’
summary: Former President Barack Obama criticized ABC's indefinite suspension of Jimmy Kimmel's show, cautioning against government coercion. Alex Abdo from Columbia labeled Brendan Carr of the FCC's actions as nearing unconstitutional coercion. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer described Carr's rhetoric as "despicable."

title: AI Revolutionizes Search Industry, Google Responds with AI Assistant
snippets: AI has changed the competitive landscape in search, with OpenAI, Perplexity and Anthropic all diving into the space.
Google says the AI assistant will be able to complete tedious tasks for users, like booking a haircut or ordering weekly groceries.
titles: Google adds Gemini to Chrome for all users in push to bolster AI search
Google brings Gemini in Chrome to US users, unveils agentic browsing capabilities, and more
summary: AI advancements have transformed the search industry, with companies like OpenAI, Perplexity, and Anthropic entering the market. Google has responded by integrating an AI assistant capable of performing routine tasks for users, such as scheduling haircuts and ordering groceries.

title: Rutgers Team Suggests Moon Observatories to Study Universe Expansion
snippets: Faint hydrogen signals from the cosmic Dark Ages may soon help determine the mass of dark matter particles. Simulations suggest future Moon-based observatories could distinguish between warm and cold dark matter, providing long-sought answers about the invisible backbone of the Universe.
A Rutgers-led team of scientists has uncovered evidence of how galaxies expand by tracing the invisible scaffolding of the universe created by a mysterious substance known as dark matter.
titles: The Moon could finally reveal dark matter
Galaxies reveal hidden maps of dark matter in the early universe
summary: A Rutgers-led scientific team has found evidence on the expansion of galaxies by studying dark matter, the universe's unseen foundation. They suggest future Moon-based observatories could use faint hydrogen signals from the cosmic Dark Ages to measure dark matter particles' mass, potentially distinguishing between warm and cold dark matter. This research offers a promising avenue for understanding the structure and expansion of the universe.

title: ABC Suspends Jimmy Kimmel's Show Amid Criticism and Nexstar Deal Controversy
snippets: The hosts of "The View" didn't discuss ABC's suspension of Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show following comments the host made about Charlie Kirk's death.
Jimmy Kimmel drew the wrath of Nexstar Media Group and Sinclair after the FCC's Carr criticized him. Nexstar has a $6.2 billion deal on the line.
titles: 'The View' is known for covering hot topics. Jimmy Kimmel's suspension wasn't one of them.
A $6.2 billion deal looms over Jimmy Kimmel's suspension
summary: ABC suspended Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show after remarks he made led to criticism from Nexstar Media Group, Sinclair, and FCC's Carr. This controversy arises amid Nexstar's ongoing $6.2 billion deal. "The View" hosts did not address the suspension.
